key_points: Tiger Woods humbly refuses the label of the Greatest of All Time (GOAT) despite Dwyane Wade's insistence.
The conversation took place during Golf Digest's A Round with Tiger: Celebrity Lessons, filmed a day before Woods' accident.
Woods, a 82-time PGA Tour and 41-time European Tour winner, insists he's 'not there yet' regarding GOAT status.
Wade, an NBA alum, labels Woods as 'The GOAT' and credits him for his own interest in golf.
Woods focuses on still playing and improving, suggesting he's 'not done' when asked about achieving GOAT status.
Ahead of the crash on Feb. 23, Woods expressed admiration for his guest's achievements in a press release for the series.
Woods underwent emergency surgery following a severe car crash, sustaining significant injuries.
Despite his injuries, Woods' attitude towards recovery and returning to golf remains optimistic.
The Los Angeles County Sheriff ruled the primary cause of Woods' crash as speed, with no signs of impairment found.
A Round with Tiger: Celebrity Playing Lessons airs through August 10, featuring various celebrities including Woods.
